column1: #text=So while most people will talk about baking a basic cake out of a box , I am actually going to be writing about re-learning how to bake one from scratch .
#text=I just found out that I have a gluten intolerance .
#text=So , I am re-learning how to do just about everything .
#text=Most of the time , you can just buy stuff from a box and add some eggs , oil and milk and call it good .
#text=Well , as there are very few gluten free baking premade box mixes , and even fewer that actually taste good , I have been teaching myself how to bake from scratch .
#text=All I really have to do is mix and match different flours .
#text=Wheat flour is sticky and fluffy , but keeps moisture well .
#text=That is part of the reason so many bake with it .
#text=If I just use rice flour , that is top dry .
#text=If I just use coconut flour , well then it all crumbles .
#text=So , what I do is buy several different kinds of flours so I can mix and match their properties and actually make tasty things that are extremely similar to the real deal .
#text=After I get the flours combined , I just add the regular ingredients , figure out a baking temperature and stick it in .
#text=Right now I keep a close eye on the food since there are n't a ton of good recipes out there .
#text=So far it has worked out well !
